meanings.definition: The act of reacting in response to a stimulus from the past.
meanings.sent1: Her retroaction to the old photograph was to smile warmly.
meanings.sent2: The retroaction of the audience to the classic song was enthusiastic applause.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's retroaction to the ancient movie was to share stories of his youth.
meanings.sent4: The retroaction of the old building to the new skyscraper was a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The retroaction of the vintage car brought back memories of a bygone era.

meanings.definition: The process of providing feedback or response to a previous action.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's retroaction on the student's essay was constructive criticism.
meanings.sent2: Effective retroaction in the workplace can lead to improved performance.
meanings.sent3: The retroaction from the computer program was unexpected but helpful.
meanings.sent4: Her retroaction to his apology was a warm smile and forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The retroaction from the customer survey highlighted areas for improvement.
